comments.body:
I'm not familiar with this library, but maybe it's supposed to be `(ref: React.RefObject<ReactNative.TextInput>) => void)`?

https://github.com/react-native-community/react-native-text-input-mask/blob/faf9a4ae6fd4e788396070542f64ffed17db79f1/index.js#L55

ref is instance.  not React.RefObject.
https://github.com/react-native-community/react-native-text-input-mask/blob/faf9a4ae6fd4e788396070542f64ffed17db79f1/index.js#L53
```
React.ClassAttributes<TextInputMask>.ref?: string | ((instance: TextInputMask | null) => void) | React.RefObject<TextInputMask> | null | undefined
```
And it can be of any type?  It's not somehow related to TextInput?
Actually TextInput. I tried to write but the error did not know why

`refInput?: (ref: ReactNative.TextInput) => void;` compiles for me.  When running the tests locally, I did have to `npm install` in `types/react`, which was somewhat non-obvious.  Maybe give that a shot?

I've already used [react-native-masked-text](https://github.com/benhurott/react-native-masked-text) replacement.
It's not convenient to provide error screenshots.
https://github.com/benhurott/react-native-masked-text/blob/master/index.d.ts#L59
